page.title: 07CANAL WALK GREENFORD
page.content: {Canal Walk}9th July 1985 (5km long). We walked westwards. On the right was open grassland and{Horsenden Hill. }To the left was{Perivale Woods}with its lovely nature trails. A sports ground now stands on the right with the new huge IBM Computer company on the left. Going under the Greenford Road bridge we saw an{Industrial {Estate}on both sides. We could smell the Mothers Pride bakery and saw the private inlets and wharves once used for loading. The came the Black Horse pub with its summer garden and the busy railway line into the City. Still more factories and 40 assorted boats and barges could be seen next. Finally going under the A40 we saw 1 holiday boat cruising, 2 walkers, 1 jogger, 6 anglers and 35 ducks. We{hope}that people will{enjoy and{maintain}this{towpath walk.
